Title:
Three new species of Conidiobolus s.s. from plant detritus in
eastern China
Keywords: Conidiobolus s.s.  Morphology Phylogeny  New species
Abstract:
The genus Conidiobolus Bref. was widely distributed, both
morphology and phylogeny confirmed that Conidiobolus in a traditional
morphological system is paraphyletic and four monophyletic groups were
separated from Conidiobolus s.l. with Conidiobolus s.s. instead of the
subgenus Delacroixia. In this study, molecular analysis of Conidiobolus
s.l. was reconstructed based on the combined nucLSU, TEF1-a and mtSSU
datasets, the result revealed three new lineages represented
Conidiobolus bifurcatus, C. taihushanensis and C. variabilis,
respectively. C. bifurcatus was related to C. brefeldianus and C.
variabilis was grouped with C. megalotocus with a relatively moderate
support, while C. variabilis formed a highly supported lineage distinct
from other Conidiobolus s.s. spp. The morphological difference of the
new species and their related species were discussed. A key to Chinese
species of Conidiobolus s.s. has been provided.
